boiler_notes.a1: Remove existing regular boiler, header tank and associated wiring.
boiler_notes.a2: Remove existing system boiler and wiring centre.
boiler_notes.a3: Remove existing combination boiler and flue.
boiler_notes.a4: Remove existing warm air unit and redundant ducting.
boiler_notes.b1: Install new regular boiler on open vented circuit with new wiring centre.
boiler_notes.b2: Install new system boiler on sealed system with integrated pump and expansion vessel.
boiler_notes.b3: Install new combination boiler with integrated filling loop and DHW outlets.
boiler_notes.t1: Flush and chemically clean system in accordance with BS7593.
boiler_notes.t2: Commission boiler and complete Benchmark certificate.
boiler_notes.t3: Ensure condensate termination meets current Building Regulations.
boiler_notes.t4: Connect controls as per manufacturer’s instructions.

flue_notes.a1: Remove existing horizontal flue terminal and wall sleeve.
flue_notes.a2: Remove existing direct rear outlet flue.
flue_notes.a3: Remove existing balanced flue terminal and back panel.
flue_notes.a4b1: Remove existing vertical flue through pitched roof and weathering kit.
flue_notes.a4b2: Remove existing vertical flue through flat roof and weathering kit.
flue_notes.a5: Remove existing open flue and brick up fireplace opening.
flue_notes.b1: Install new horizontal flue to manufacturer’s specification.
flue_notes.b1a: Install new fanned flue horizontal kit with wall terminal.
flue_notes.b4: Install new vertical flue through roof with approved flashing kit.
flue_notes.t1: Ensure new terminal meets clearance requirements per BS5440.
flue_notes.t2: Add plume kit with extensions and 45° elbows as required.
flue_notes.t3: Fit terminal guard where required by location.

cylinder_notes.a1: Remove existing vented cylinder, feed and expansion tank and associated pipework.
cylinder_notes.a2: Remove existing unvented cylinder and discharge pipework.
cylinder_notes.a3: Remove existing thermal store or combination cylinder.
cylinder_notes.b1: Install new unvented cylinder with pressure reducing valve and discharge pipework to G3 standards.
cylinder_notes.b2: Install new thermal store with primary heat exchanger and blending valve.
cylinder_notes.t1: Insulate all new pipework and update labels.
cylinder_notes.t2: Cap redundant cold feed and vent connections safely.
cylinder_notes.t3: Install tundish and discharge route in accordance with manufacturer’s instructions.
cylinder_notes.t4: Install blending valve and commission for correct mixed temperature.

condensate_notes.a1: Existing internal condensate route to waste.
condensate_notes.b1: Provide new internal condensate route to waste with continuous fall.
condensate_notes.b2: Provide new external condensate route in 32mm pipework, fully lagged.
condensate_notes.b3: Install new condensate pump with flexible discharge hose.
condensate_notes.b4: Install separate condensate run for new appliance.
condensate_notes.t1: Install visible air break and trap as per BS6798.
condensate_notes.t2: Terminate to external soakaway or gully with insulation.
condensate_notes.t3: Fit non-return valve to prevent cross-contamination.
condensate_notes.t4: Provide electrical supply for pump via fused spur.
condensate_notes.t5: Remove redundant condensate pump and reconnect to gravity drain.

regular_to_combi: System will be converted from open vent to sealed. Remove feed and expansion tanks and cap redundant pipework.
Mains pressure hot water will replace gravity supply. Check compatibility of showers and taps.
Any existing shower pumps will be removed as they are not suitable for pressurised systems.
regular_to_system: System will be converted from open vent to sealed. Ensure pressure relief and expansion vessel installed.
Feed and expansion tanks will be removed from loft.
system_to_combi: System remains sealed; however, hot water will now be mains pressure. Confirm shower and tap suitability.
Remove any hot water pumps no longer required.
combi_to_system: Reverts from instantaneous DHW to stored cylinder. Confirm space and discharge pipework available.
System remains sealed; expansion vessel to be sized for total volume.
combi_to_regular: System will revert to open vented. Feed and expansion tanks required.
Ensure correct venting and safety discharge routes reinstated.
system_to_unvented: System remains sealed. Ensure G3 certification for unvented installation.
Hot water pressure increased; verify outlet compatibility and shower suitability.
regular_to_unvented: Conversion from open vent to unvented sealed system. Remove tanks and install expansion control.
Hot water pressure increased; pumps will be redundant and may require removal.
